Reviews.Title: “They make you feel confenient.”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam_beagle
Reviews.Content: In many Spanish situations the lack of speaking English is hopeless. On arrival at this hotel it was different, however? Do they have handouts? The little English she spoke was enough to subscribe and make one feel comfortable. Did the elderly lady on duty on our morning of arrival understood our questions or not; we left our lugguage in a sort of lobby and when we came back in the hotel in the afternoon we found everything arranged in our promised room. No, no extra's. Not at the desk and not on or in the room. Breakfast is all around any corner and drinks are served 24/7 outside, no minibar. For a reservation in a low budget place like this we were surprised about what we got!

Reviews.Title: “Just in heart of Madrid city center”
Reviews.Author: Konstantin T
Reviews.Content: Positive sides: - Outstanding stuff: Jose, speaks perfect english, spannish and russian (maybe even more!) - Good price for such location - Free wifi - GREAT LOCATION - clean rooms - Sol plaza in 5min walking distance; - city tour bus and shopping area in 5min walking distance; - souveneers shops and Jamon museum in 3min walking distance. Negative: - no breakfast; - old rooms Definitely recommend this place! Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: cdmm58
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights and found the hotel extremely well positioned to Sol, Plaza Mayor, Prado, etc. It's a bargain for the old warm charm of the place. Sure the walls are thin and neighbors can be heard at times but that's Spain generally. lively neighborhood with lots of good tapa and copa bars. Good security. Have been to Madrid 7 times, but my first time here, I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sonia02gh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the center of the town. It is near the metro station Sevilla and Sol. There are plenty of restaurants and bars near the hotel. The room was clean and big. We wanted a room facing the interior court in order to be less noise. Indeed it was a quiet room, but because it was on the first floor, there wasn’t enough light. Cleaning is done daily. There are bathroom articles which are replaced daily. I didn’t enjoy the bed; it wasn’t too comfortable. The staff doesn’t speak good English (only one of them was able to articulate in English), and weren’t extremely friendly, but it was ok. On the whole, I would definitely recommend the hotel, because I consider that you get even better than you pay for. It is really good for young couples who want to visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, old fashion room but noisy”
Reviews.Author: YW L
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is only within walking distance to most of the touristy locations and it makes you feel like you're in Spain because sometimes going in a 5 star hotel makes you forget where you are. This one is old fashioned and looks like family run. The rooms got proper furniture and bed, the bath room is good size. The problem I found is - no wifi here and it's a bit noisy since it's close to the main road. The staffs are friendly but speak very limited English. But I CAN'T complain because for the price I paid, the service and room were very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: R0zaS
Reviews.Content: When I had booked this hotel, I'd been allured by its location and price. The price is very good. So, I was ready to live in small room without windows:) But in fact, I was pleasantly surprised. The room was pretty big, there was a lot of empty space, the bed was well enough (it had one minus - I'd booked one double-bed, instead, we were offered two single-beds, but they were eventually put together by the maid, as it is not allowed in this hotel to move furniture). There was a conditioner, but we stayed there in December, it was useless for us. The bathroom had actual bathtub instead of shower. Everything was rather clean, and the clean service was there everyday. It was one disappointment for us in the room - it was not allowed to eat there, so we hid our jamon in the purse:)) The staff was very nice. During the days there was the nice woman who spoke Spanish and uderstood Italian, during the evenings and nights there was man who spoke also English and Russian. Location is absolutely excellent! It is 4 minutes walk from the main square Puerta del Sol. And you can reach all the main attractions very fast from there - Prado is 10 minutes to the right, Palacio Real is 15 minutes to the left. Metro station, fast metro station are also there, like a numerous shops, restaurants etc. We really enjoyed our staying in Hotel Santander.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but light sleepers beware”
Reviews.Author: BackpackerNoMore62
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Santander for two nights at the beginning of a trip during which we mostly visited Morocco. We wanted a reasonably priced room that also gave us proximity to the three major Madrid museums. The Santander was all of that, and it provided a reasonably large room that was nicely furnished and had comfortable beds. The hotel has a small elevator, so it's not necessary to walk stairs. However, being central, we also got our share of street noises even though our room faced on a small street rather than on the main. My wife, who is a light sleeper, definitely needed her ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location....generous room”
Reviews.Author: Neha B
Reviews.Content: I m just back from a 12 day trip to spain & during our visit to madrid we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. First, the USP of this hotel is its very convinient location, very central, near to SOL metro stop.the entire locality is very alive & happening, sol & plaza mayor are nearby.so great evenings are guaranteed.the rooms are clean & size is pretty good,clealiness is appreciable. the only drawback some people may find is the noisy street, which almost never sleeps.but then you r in spain to enjoy nightlife...the reception is friendly,though english is a problem,but thats true for whole of spain.there are lots of places to eat around, so that makes up for not having a restaurent in the hotel.plaza santa ana is also nearby.overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: Zastrow_Lindsey
Reviews.Content: For a two star hotel I felt this was a very nice place and the rooms were very spacious. Although I felt it was a bit expensive I really enjoyed my stay. It was very quite and I was able to sleep everynight without disturbance. This hotel is near the Plaza de Cibeles where everyone in Madrid goes to celebrate after a big futbol win. I stayed here when Real Madrid won the copa del rey and it was actually very quite and I was able to sleep with my window open.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: StevenHoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been selected after reviewing the budget hotels in the centre (Sol region) of Madrid. The selection came down for it was one of the cheapest with reasonable reviews. We've requested a quiet room (not on street side) and a double bed, upon arrival exact such a room was prepared (room 103)! The bed was a bit hard but it was totally quiet. Staff was friendly (helped with making reservations etc), hotel was clean, rooms where roomy (for European standards). All and all an excellent stay for a low budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Javamonsoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the center of everything we wanted to see in Madrid and, not only was the rate per night great, but we also saved money by walking to everything from this central location. The room was clean and large and the bathroom was clean and large, also. It was a little noisy outside but that is to be expected in such a central location. The only problem we had was that there was no internet in the hotel but we just went to the local Starbucks and got free wifi connections.

Reviews.Title: “Not what was expected”
Reviews.Author: CaptDrakes
Reviews.Content: Great location, that's about all the good. There was no wi-fi, and the bed was a bit too firm. There was a knocking sound that occurred the whole night, probably the radiator. There were posted rules that were not mentioned on the website, such as no food in the room, you can't wash your clothes in the bathroom, etc. After one sleepless night, we knew we had to change hotels. The gentleman at the front desk offered no resistance, and was polite.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned hotel with good service...”
Reviews.Author: CharlieBeckett
Reviews.Content: Old fashioned hotel with good service, great location and reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RTravels143
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel and then told me about it. I was a little apprehensive after reading all the reviews. Once we got there, i was pleased. The price was fair, location was great! The room did look like a room in an old house but the bed was a good size, the shower was hot and the maid changed the sheets everyday. Id definitely recommend this hotel. I thought it was simple but what we needed. Also, when we were there, staff was friendly. Didn't go out of their way to make a conversation but answered all our questions and friendly doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great price but seems like grandmother's house!”
Reviews.Author: OMPAC
Reviews.Content: First, let me tell you what i was looking in a hotel in Madrid: central and safe location, low price, clean place with ensuite bathroom. Í've got all that with Santander and that's why i rate this as "very good". But i know that's not a fancy hotel with very good amenities! I´m aware that that's not an hotel to spend time in. But is a nice place to go to sleep at nigth after a long day (and night!) in Madrid. The rooms are big and confortable. It seems like you are sleeping in grandmother's house, but most of the things look rather new, only with an antique feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, HORRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: mdr1307
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and in a great loaction however the customer service is rediculously bad. They are increddibly rude and not helpful. The two managers we seen remind us of the movie psycho. Very creepy and silent. They creep around the hotel and stand silently in the shaddows just staring at you. If its late and you get back to the hotel they belittle you even if you wisper in the lobby. I had been all around the world and stayed in many hotels and have never ever been treated like this. They couldnt even answer if the restaurant next door to them was any good. How do you not know that if you are the "concierge" . The hotel is in the party area as well so if you are going to be partying do your self a fav and dont stay there.

Reviews.Title: “One star hotel, more of lodge”
Reviews.Author: ajvima
Reviews.Content: Its supposed to be 2 star hotel. I would give one star. Some would say it is sort of an antique hotel, not for me. I didn't like the main entrance, it was not spacious. The lift has a gate and a door .. can you imagine a double door lift. With 3 bags in the lift, me and wife didn't fit in. The key to the room was funniest, it a huge iron key chain. You need to lock the door from inside, it doesn't lock automatically. We didn't have Air conditioning, when we asked how to switch it on, we were told it's only ON in summers. Give me a break it was 80F out there. There are hotel rules there, the beds are apart seperated by a furniture. Hotel rules say we cant move furniture. So be ready to sleep seperately. Nothing sound proof, you can hear people of the street and in the hotel. We woke up at 4AM, because some drunk women was shoot in the streets and we could hear everything, with doors shut. We could hear room service cleaning the rooms too. Bathroom: Looks so old, not inviting. Pluses: - Its cheap. - Its in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: clairegowland
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is brilliant, literally a two minute walk from the metro (either Sol or Sevilla) The rooms are immaculate, showers hot and bed comfortable. However, the hotel seemed a little "stuffy", our room was facing an enclosed courtyard and there was little natural light. But - for something in central Madrid, the room was silent! Was definately a good base, but for 80 euros a night, we found that some of the hostals offr better budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful...”
Reviews.Author: yappy1
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't disagree entirely with most of the reviews about this hotel - mainly because of the excellent location - but with some provisos. First you do get what you pay for - this is a pretty run down dated place and the room allocated to us was small and dingy and with no natural light. Second, the customer service is non existant. My wife and I asked the manager the most straightforward of questions and we get a shrug like don't bother me. You feel like you are an imposition/idiot for even asking... . Also just be aware of the no left luggage rule on checkout. It seems a bit mean spirited as there appears to be the room in the hotel. We ended up lugging it to Atocha station (the nearest alternative) . Again this policy just seems to demonstrate the lack of interest the Santander show once you have signed up. Agree the location is terrific but if cost is your only other thing - which other reviewers here rave about - would suggest you save even more and consider the hostels which are littered around the exact same area . They looked pretty similar in standard to the Santander. For others wanting a genuine hotel service this hotel will be a dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Troubadour
Reviews.Content: Our double room (212) with a built-in bathroom was pleasant, clean, quiet and not too small. As the previous reviews have pointed out, Santander is within walking distance of most sights, both the museums and restaurants/bars. The dusty Venecia sherry bar just down the lane is a true gem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MPS_VP
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on TripAdvisor. We were very pleased. While the staff isn't overwhelmingly friendly they are polite, efficent and helpful. The room was great; I think it had recently been redone. It had high ceilings and tall windows with parquet floors. The double bed was comfortable (not two singles pushed together!) and the other furnishings were new. The full bath had also been very recently redone. The hotel is very quiet. One thing that we particularly liked ( and hadn't expected) was how good the location was. It really is walking distance to the principle parks, museums and the palace as well as shopping. As importantly it's on the edge of a seemingly endless restaurant/club zone that goes on for blocks and blocks, interruped by small squares and plazas. A lot of the streets are car free. The crowds on the street and cafes are friendly and mixed - from kids to grannies dressed up to the 9's!! Great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Santander Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: jenhb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Santander was exactly what we wanted for a short break - cheap, no frills, but very clean and quiet and in a great central location, between Sol and the Prado. We paid 75 Euros per night for a double room with bathroom and stayed 3 nights. Our room was at the back of the building, so was very quiet, but I don't think any of the rooms would have suffered street noise as the hotel mainly faces a side street. The whole hotel appeared to be newly decorated (in an old fashioned style) but perhaps it was just cleaned to a very high standard. Basically we wanted a room to sleep in, as we were out doing the sights all day and this was ideal. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but there is a pleasant bar/cafe next door which serves breakfast and we enjoyed eating out at different restaurants in the evenings - recommend the area around Plaza St. Anna, just down the street. All the main tourist destinations are within easy walking distance. Only (slight) disadvantage was that there is no left luggage facility after 3 pm. Overall, friendly staff and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location, near Plaza Santa Anna and reasonable walking distance from Sol metro station. Great value at 64 Euro for double room with private bath. Small hotel, but clean and we had a comfortable room. Tiny elevator. Hotel has a cozy feel, not much of a lobby. Most front desk staff spoke some english. Our room did not have a view of anything but the adjacent office building. At night the plumbing of adjacent rooms and elevator can be heard, but not much street noise from our room. The location is great, we never used the metro/subway except to get to the train station. Walking distance to the major attractions like Plaza Mayor, Prado Museum, Plaza Santa Anna, Palacio Real, and old Madrid. Plenty of restaurants, shops and even internet center close-by. We felt the location was safe.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room and location were ok. But the front desk were basically inethical---they quoted one price, then was our luggage was up in the room, they changed the price, and then finally--and worse, without any advance notice they charged the final amount in US dollars to include not only a horrible exchange rate, but also the Visa fee. I've never experienced this kid of run-around. Avoid. If you do stay--pay in Euros and make it clear in writing what the fee is... I would never trust those guys again. I left ad went to another hotel and didn't feel robbed.....the people at the other hotel had never heard of such a thing.
